Focus group.ad_copy: PERSON_1 finds the Mediterranean vegan restaurant concept creative and beneficial for flavor. They suggest locations in NDG due to heavy foot traffic and health-conscious individuals, and propose vegan moussaka and dolmades as menu items. They emphasize the importance of a cozy atmosphere with natural elements and suggest Instagram marketing with coupons and discounts to attract customers. They also highlight the need for local partnerships to keep costs low while maintaining quality and suggest partnering with local farmers and Quebec grocery stores. They conclude that the model is useful and fresh products are a priority.

PERSON_2 believes the Mediterranean vegan restaurant idea is fantastic and innovative, with a growing market for both Mediterranean and vegan food. They suggest locations in Plateau Mont-Royal, Mile End, NDG, Old Montreal, and Westmount. They propose vegan spanakopita with tofu-based feta as a menu item and suggest a price point of $15-$18. They emphasize the importance of a cozy and inviting atmosphere and suggest a location size of 1500-2000 square feet. They recommend Instagram marketing with photos of food, coupons, and partnerships to attract customers. They also express concern that prices stay reasonably inexpensive through partnerships and quality.
